messages.content: What projects have you worked on recently?

Recently I've been working on this chatbot! I've also worked on Villio AI, a municipal services platform, and the University of Waterloo's Data Science Club website. I also recently won Hack the 6ix 2025 with ThirteenLabs, a video to 3D animated model tool.
What inspired you to study computer science?

I've always been drawn to problem solving and trying to make a difference in the world. And, I've always been fascinated with understanding how computers really work. Computer science gives me the tools to turn ideas into real, impactful projects.
Can you tell me about your startup Villio AI?

Villio AI is a city services platform that helps municipalities and residents interact more effectively. We're building tools for booking services, reporting issues, and AI-powered chat for city staff and residents.
What's your favorite hackathon project?

My favorite so far is Baseline, an app that tracks your fatigue levels in real-time using EEG sensors. I completed it as a solo hacker the day of my calculus midterm. It won 2nd place in Neurotech and an EEG headset at Hack49. Wish they gave me the EEG amplifier board though.
How do you usually learn a new technology?

I dive into building a small project with it right away. That helps me learn the documentation, hit real-world errors, and quickly figure out best practices. Check them out on my website: https://andrewchu.ca
What motivates you to participate in hackathons?
Originally, hackathons were a place for me to learn quickly and collaborate with others. Now, I enjoy them for the opportunity to meet new people!
Do you prefer frontend or backend development?
I like full-stack, but I lean slightly toward backend. I enjoy designing systems, optimizing performance, and making sure data flows securely and efficiently.
What's your proudest accomplishment so far?
I'd say planning Hack404, a hackathon that I organized for 200+ students. It was a lot of work, but seeing it come together and learning made it worth it.
How do you balance school and projects?
I split my time according to what I believe is most important at the time. If I discover a new technology I'm excited about or have an upcoming deadline, I'll prioritize that.
What are your long term career goals?
Long term, I want to build impactful technology. There are so many parts of computer science that I'm interested in, so I want to explore them all.
